intro: Tocoyena bullata, commonly known as the bullate tocoya, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the Amaryllidaceae family and is characterized by its striking, showy inflorescences. The plant produces large, bell-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pink, often with a yellow or greenish tinge. Tocoyena bullata is typically found in moist, shaded environments such as rainforests and understorey habitats. Its botanical features make it a popular ornamental plant in horticulture due to its unique floral display.
